text: On tap at brewery. Amber color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma is more on the pale (than dark) side, which is good. Light to medium bitter, light malty, not really sweet. Very good.

bread, dough, 
amber, hazy, white foam, frothy, 
medium bitterness, 
medium body, thick feel, malty, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Bottle split out side P-Arch with thanks to Harrisoni, 11/03/17.
Golden amber with a decent egg shell white head.
Nose is brown bread, biscuit malts, cereals, light berry fruit.
Taste comprises toasted grains, fruit loaf, malts, biscuit crumble, light wood, dusty notes, some backseat toffee action.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, moderately drying close.
This seems to be the Rolls Royce of the Polotmavy style from the few Ive experienced !.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
On tap, @Kláterní Pivovar Strahov, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color amarillo, corona de espuma blanca, sabor maltoso alguna nota especiada y herbal, cuerpo medio.

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Brewery, London (11/03/2017) - (thanks to Ian) golden amber pour with white head. Sweet and toasted malty aroma and taste, some caramel and toffee sweetness, cereal, rye, nice toasty bitter finish. Good stuff.
Bottle share in Bermondsey thanks to Ian. Amber pour with a fluffy white head. Tangerine, toffee and peach aroma. Caramel and sweet fruit flavour. Not bad.

Bottle shared in Bermondsey / huge thanks to Ian for this rare scoop! Pours clear honey-gold with a creamy, white head. Toasted biscuits in the nose, understated caramel notes. Light-medium sweet flavour with more hearty, bready biscuits, faint orangey notes, hay. Light bodied, smooth, with fine carbonation. Creamy finish, light grassy hop, more lightly toasted biscuits, bread. Great lager.

Bottle, big thanks to Ian. It pours clear deep golden - amber with a medium white head. The aroma is rich, malt - driven, brown bread, rivita, toasty grain, cereal and touch of orange sherbet. The taste is smooth, bitter, rich malty action, bitter - sweet, wood, leather, cereal, toasty grain, spice and toasted grain with a drying, woody finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Good example of style.

Bottle from a colleague at work. Hazy red brown amber lasting cream head. lager aroma. Sweet czech malt aroma. Smooth in mouth. Rather a good polotmavy touch of smoke. Really good lager. Love the balance.

Pite 21.02.2017
Aromat ciężki, słodowy, ale nie jakiś bardzo odrzucający. Smak tak samo. Nie za wiele się dzieje. Jak na lagera pije się przyjemnie

From tap at Kláterní Pivovar Strahov with Gunnars ryk & reis 06.11.16. Hazy orange. Dense and persistent foamy beige head and lacing. Aroma of hops and malt. Very hoppy taste, with meadows, grass and a hint of citrus. Long and medium bitter aftertaste.

Tap @Kláterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours cloudy and amber, thick white head. Nose is vegetables, grass, malty. Taste is vegetables, bitter at first with a sweetening finish. This is my 77th style of beer, done it.
BOTTLE 50CL. Rotten fruity malts, light fruity sweetness, almost no bitterness. What the hell?
Tap at brewpub. Amber color, thick white head. Aroma of caramel malt, nuts, bittering hops. Tatse is easy drinkable, fresh, decent balanced

Amber, hazy. Aroma breadcrusr, toffee and hints of sulfur. Palate medium, low carbonation. Very malt-driven, medium sweer caramel, finish balanced. Ok, no big flaws on this one but nothing special really. Have had better lagers.

Piwo bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana średniopęcherzykowa, raczej trwała, redukuje się do pierścienia. Lepi szkło. W aromacie słodowe, chmiele, trochę ziół, lasu, owoców, minimum karmelu. W smaku wyraźna, średnia goryczka. W posmaku goryczka się zwiększa. Wysycenie średnie, ciało zaskakująco wysokie jak na lagera. To moja pierwsza przygoda z tym gatunkiem, zaskakujące wysokie ciało. Całkiem dobre Gdyby w Polsce browary restauracyjne zamiast marcowego robiło taką robotę.... ehhhh można pomarzyć.
From tap. Pours clear amber with medium white head. Aroma of malts, bread, hops, grass. Medium body with average carbonation. Taste is mild bitter. Nice and refreshing.

Look; off white head, near clear amber (jantar) body. 
Aroma; very fruity, leaves, berries, very fruity.
Tasty; sweet soft hops, fruity malts, berries and butter caramel. Fruity malty soft tale.
Palate; fine soft.
Overall a fruity n easy jantar, tasty of course.
[at Strahov Klaster tourist trap]

Amber, clear, meadium white foam; caramel, citruses, bread in aroma; medium bitter, slightly sour and sweet; medium body, little oily, average- carbonation, moderately long bittersweet finish;
Overall: quite refreshing, highly drinkable, nice taste, good beer
Tap @ the brewery. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich caramel, fruits, malt and hops. Smootha nd easy drinkable. Nice.

From tap. Pours hazy amber with an off white head. Aroma of bread crust, grains, caramel, straw, crisp, quite hoppy. Taste is the same, super easy drinking, perfectly balanced, I keep wanting more. Damn good!
Tap at the brew pub. Pours hazy amber with a white head. ARoma of hops, chewy caramel,fresh bread, mild dried fruits, a hint of grass, hoppy! Taste is hopward, chewy and crisp. Very solid brew!
Good, solid full bodied Marzen, though ticks the Vienna box as well. Malt forward, a tad creamy, lightly roasted finish.
Bärnstensfärgad öl med ett smutsvitt skum. Maltighet och rostat bröd i aromen. I smaken tillkommer en fruktighet med äpple och päron.

@Klasterni Pivovar Strahov in Prague. Medium amber colored body, medium to smaller sized off-white head, soapy lacing. Light caramel, biscuit, honey, florals, and cereals. Medium bodied, semi-sweet, rounded finish.
On tap. Clear amber/red color with white head. Aroma - Caramel, toffee. Taste - Sweet, malts, honey, biscuits, caramel.
Very good beer. The taste is very malted with a little hop. Its not so bitter. The colour is like a dark hazelnut. Overall a good and tasty beer!

On tap at Strahov monastery brewpub, Prague. Semi-clear amber with a frothy off white head, long lasting but diminishing. Malty, some grain and some fruits. Light, malty, some bitterness, otherwise sweet. Medium body, could have fuller taste, soft carbonation. Drinkable, but to light, similar to their summer ale.

Draught @ the brewpub. Pours very slightly hazy amber with stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and hops, with notes of yeast and touches of fruit. Sweetish, malty and estery flavour, beautifully complemented by bitter, hoppy notes. Bready and caramellish touches. Bitter and estery aftertaste. A very, very good Polotmavy!

Strahov tasting continued. This was a nice follow-up to the Easter special, especially accompanied by Czech pickled sausage and onion soup as first course. Fresh bread, good interpretation of the style.
5.8.2014. Slightly stuffy aroma with cereal. Taste is slightly sweet, malty, somehops, honey. Dont know if its really esb but nice.

From tap - 0,25l at brewpub. Pours nice clear amber liquid, medium white frothy head, fell down after a while, but small layer stayed. Aroma: rich malty, caramel, krowky (polish caramel-milk sweets), bread crust, rather sweet character, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, malty, caramel, bread, perfect, Palate: medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, long bitter caramel finish, high drinkeability, Overall: excelent Pilsner style amber lager, very drinakble, nice appearence (only the head could be more durable) and rich aroma. One of the best,

Keg at the Brewpub in Day 1 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 29/09/14. Clouded light amber / orange coloured pour with a big ol frothy off white head. Aroma is earthy grainy, wheat and rye cereals, wort, light spicy hop. Flavour is composed of toasty bread, light char, earthy grains, hint of roast. Solid bitter finish. Malt led and earthy. Slightly harsh in the finish.
the best czech lager in my opinion. caramel, golden, clear, rocky head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, fizzy,
On tap at Kláterní pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours amber with nice off-white head. Malty aroma. Malty bready flavor, slightly hoppy bitter. Medium bodied. Refreshing.
Amber color with nice white head. Medium carbonation and fully bodied. Citric aroma. Taste is malt, floral and sweet. Medium bitterness. Aftertaste is long, sweet, bitter and dry.
Golden to brown colour. Caramel tones in the aroma. Very drinkable lager with nicely balanced malts and hops. Medium body.
Slovní hodnocení přidám v nejblií moné době, jakmile jej naťukám do počítače. Vá alkoholík.

Aroma: bread malts, light yeast, light iron. Appearance: clear amber, medium white frothy head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: malty notes come back quickly, getting quite bitter in the average-long dry finish. Overall: my first Polotmavý , nice and refreshing. Pint at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague.

clear amber colour, huge yellowish off-white head; aroma of grains, floral hops, bread, caramel and fruity notes;taste of malty sweetness with less intensive hoppy bitterness and fruity notes; good polotmavy

Výčap Kláterní Pivovar Strahov. Tmavá jantárová farba, krásna biela krémová pena. Vôňa ovocná, orieková, karamelová. V chuti jemná sladkosť, ovocné tóny, v pozadí karamel a orieky. Stredne plné telo, ľahko nasýtené. Veľmi osvieujúce.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma : Light sweet, malty, leather.
Appearance : Cloudy, light amber color. Huge white head.
Taste : Medium sweet, light caramel.
Palate : Medium body. Ligth astringent finish.
Overall : Some weird taste.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 On tap, u2p, 58 czk per 0.3l 
Dark amber body with white head. Aroma has light fruity with touch of caramel. Long lasting bitterness in the taste, malty sweetness, very well balanced. Body is full, high carbonation.

Rating from 5/22/2014 2:10:26 PM; 8/3/6/3/14.
On tap, OP, 34 czk/0.3 l. Dark amber body with low creamy head. Aroma is nutty, walnuts, touches of caramel. Taste has medium sweetness with high earthy bitterness. Fresh noble hops in the after taste. Body is full, medium carbonation.

Blek blek, drinkable but expensive in the Czech circumstances. Happy happy but not so killing impressions as in other cases. [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ pub

500 ml swingtop bottle. Courtesy of Jamedra, Thanks. Pours a gorgeous reddish-copper color with a big fluffy off-white head that has fantastic retention. The aroma is somewhat subdued with sweet malts, rock candy and a bit of spice. The taste is similarly subtle with sweet malts, bread, persimmons and something spicy. The palate is just a bit thinner than I would prefer and the carbonation is lively. Finishes short and clean. Overall: Very satisfying and enjoyable to drink.

Fra fat på bryggeripuben 8 Sep 13. Amber. Middels høyt skum som varer en stund. Litt lacing. Uklar. Bra fruktaroma. Plommer. Smaken behagelig fruktig. Plommer & fersken. Litt syrlighet i ettersmaken. Smakte herlig etter en fin spasertur gjennom parken opp til klostret en varm søndags formiddag.

Draught
Aroma-yeast
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, bitter finish
Overall-very good

This was a special bottle hand delivered from Czech republic by Mom and Dad. Figuring out how to add rating was like a lesson in Czech. Jantar = amber. Polotmavy (the style) literally translates to "shadowy". This is the real deal- the amber lager of the Czech Republic. Pours a nice deep orange with a decent head. Has the definite crispness of a lager with some of the warmth that a darker malt brings. Fairly light mouthfeel and a good amount of bitterness in the finish. Definitely has spicy notes typical of the region. Really ncie. Perfect way to celebrate move.
Amber colour, 1 finger white head. Aroma of malts, honey. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Very drinkable
50cl bottle thanks to Jamedra. Nice cloudy dark orange color with persistent smooth white head. Carbonatio is soft. Body is medium. Aroma is malty, brett, basement, wood, hop. Lovely!
Amber with white head. Aroma is biscuit, dough, light earth notes. Flavor is similar to the aroma with grains and sweetness. Good, easy lager.

Appearance: Cloudy amber color with a nice creamy off white head. Good lacing. Aroma: Malty and fruity.Palate: Medium body. Slight sweet and an ok bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Mild caramel malty and fine fruity.Overall impression: Nice refreshing and tasty ale.Personal stats: Bottle as Svatý Norbert Speciální Polotmavé 13 from a trade with Cuso
On tap. Pours hazy amber color with white head. Aroma grassy, hoppy and bit malty. Tastes prety the same as aroma, with some fruit hints. Hoppy bitter finish.
On tap at Richtar Jakub in Bratislava. Overall very tasty and refreshing. Malty aroma, hoppy finish.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2013 500 ml bottle as Sv Norbert Special Beer Amber Lager. BB? From Cuso. Cheers!
Hazy brown colour with a small white head. 
Berries, mild diacetyl sweetness, mild bitterness and some farmyard notes in the aroma. 
The flavour is quite nice. Theres bitterness, candy sweetness, hops and biscuit malt in the flavour. Bitterness in the aftertaste.

On tap @ Strahov, Prague. Unfiltered.
Aromas of grain (but again, it was in the air that day), hops, fresh, creamy, dairy.
Amber body, off-white creamy head. Sparkling and lacing.
Fruity taste, clear hops, mild bitterness.
A slightly bitter finish, refreshing yet warming. Medium bodied, full taste.

Thanks to Ryan for sharing this. The pour is amber in color with an off-white head. Toasted bread and sweet malt on the nose. Really fruity and heavy on the esters, too. Sweet malty flavor. Lots of toast and bread with a ton of fruit esters. Pear, apple, and grapes. Light hops in the background.
Bottle thanks to GT2s friends. Amber body, thick white head, smelled of pear, a little fruity but very drinkable. Nice!

From tap @Richtár Jakub, Bratislava. Dense eggshell colored top. Shiny amber body. Light grassy and fruity hop aroma, paired by a whiff of toasty and light caramelly malts. Toasted malt flavor as well. Medium bitterness, more earthy than fruity. Healthy body. Balanced malty and light bitterish ending. Good stuff. [13.04.13]

500mL flip-top thanks to Mowbeer as "Sv. Norbert Special Amber". Clear, full amber. Medium head with healthy lacing. Nose is sweet cherry, amaretto, licorice, mace. Really nice. Taste is dark bread, whole wheat crust, cracked grain. No caramel surprisingly unlike the Czech pilsners that were caramel laden. You would think it would be reversed. Denser palate. Malt forward all the way but not cloying or sticky. Nice.

Bottle from Cuso.  Thanks!  Pours a cloudy dark orange with a white head.  Aromas of caramel, toffee, bread, noble type hops.  Spicy hops hit you first, followed by a long, drawn out bready malt.  Finishes dry. Pretty damn good.

On tap at Klasterni Strahov. Slightly hazy gold pour. Malty, biscuity aroma, not really toasty like a traditional polotmave, light caramel notes. Malty, biscuity flavour, light honey, much more reminiscent of a malty svetle than an acutal polotmave. Palate is silky, smooth carbonation, smooth finish. Not inspired by Czech tradition, but still quite good.

Bernsteinfarben mit reichlich Schaum. Getreidiges Malzaroma hopfig unterlegt. Startet ungewöhnlich süß wie bayrisch Blockmalz, wird dann aber zunehmend würziger. Die Hopfenherbe ist verhalten. Solide Braukunst vom Klosterberg Prags!

Draught at the brewpub. Aroma is lots of toasted bread and herbal Saaz hoppiness, plus notes of fruit and nuts. Simple yet masterfully put together. Medium body, soft, balanced, malty taste, medium bitterness and a hoppy-nutty aftertaste. Seems I have found the perfect vienna, its so quaffable, I would like to drink bucketloads of it.

Amber 
Kobber klar skum crem lang 
Malt brændt tømmer humle citrus frugt
Bitter modrat sød lidt 
Livlig vandede
5-4-6-4-12
aug 12

Keg at the Brewpub. Pours a reddy Amber with a thick White head. Aroma of sweet malt and grassy hops. Flavour is not as sweet as other Viennas. More lagery. Nice grassy Saaz hops lead to a pleasant bitter finish.
UPDATED: SEP 4, 2012 On tap at the brewpub. Pours lovely amber color with thick creamy white head. Aroma is malt, hops, honey, copper. Taste very similar. Lovely.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 On tap at the brewpub. Lightly hazy amber colour. Big white head. Aroma grassy, hoppy, very light citrus fruits. Taste medium hoppy, nice hop profile with some citrus fruits, light sweet caramel. Very nice balance. Finish is floral medium. Very good beer. Rerate at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Aroma malty, caramel, lightly nutty, apricot. Clear amber colour. Taste is caramel malty, grassy hoppy. Quite high sweetness and bitterness both. Finish lightly sourish, bitter hops.
Tap @ Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague. Pours amber with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, bread, grassy hops. Flavor of malt, sweet fruit, grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. 070812
(on tap) Amber, slightly hazy, white head. Toasted aroma, hoppy as well. Light to medium bitter, not sweet. Light body. Good drinkability, well-crafted.
Velmi chutný pivák, točený v pivovaru strahovský kláter. Cena sice turistická a tudí vyí, ale stojí za to.
Tap/ The head is ok, the colour amber. The taste is intensiv hoppy a bit fruity and bitter. Also there are some different types of malt. Good combination, very nice and tasty beer!

Bottle. Thanks to Larsa! Pours amber with a white head. Aroma has got notes of marzipan, flowers and citrus. Taste has got notes of flowers and strawberries. Long but not aggressive aftertaste. Refreshing sparkling feeling.
Bottle from brewery. Amber color with huge foamy white head. Hoppy aroma. Taste, malt, bitter hops, fruity hints, some spices in background. Nice long bitter finish. Nice stuff.

Draft at the brewpub, Summer 2011.  The pour yields a lightly hazy reddish amber body with a tall, foamy, beige tinted head.  Lasting a good while, the head slowly gives way to thick, broken walls of lacing.  Aromas are based in moderately caramelized cereal grain, touching on some mineral character, and showing just a flash of floral hoppiness.  The flavor offers up a surprising bit of crisp acidity that cuts through the caramel sugars and cereal, allowing for the floral hops to press forward and assert themselves a bit more.  On the palate, a light to moderate body sports lively carbonation and the aforementioned acidic crispness on the finish.  Still, theres really not a ton going on here.  Its a decent amber lager, but it pales in comparison to others within the region.
Reddish brown with a medium, off white head. Malty with fruity tones. Malt, hops and high carbonation. Medium body with a nice, bitter after taste.

Draught @ Klasterni Pivovar Strahov. Rated on 14.7.2009Aroma has a lot of diacetyl and butter. Flavour has butter and diacetyl too and it is kind of harsh and stinging with sweet malt and hints of metal. This is definitely not my kind of beer or then I got my sample from a bad keg or tap.
Tap at brewpub. Copper pour, beautiful frothy head. Aroma of sweet malt and good grassy hop. Flavor has a great refreshing balance and good carbonation on the palate. Very nice.

On tap at Brew Pub
Aroma slight off notes of wet cloth , malty feel , with grainy finish.
 Appearance  hazed amber with large fine frothy top. Good lace.
Flavor and Palate : Fresh , soft sweet frontal malty character. This was followed by drier mid paired with fresh hop. Chewy body. Refreshing pleasant amber lager. This would be excellent if not the aroma.

Pours a bright orange with a big white head and some lace. The aroma is earthy and mildly malty with some nice spicy hoppiness and some rose like floral character. The flavor is bursting with bright maltiness and there is an underbelly of earthy bitterness throughout. The horehound note shows up nicely in this which makes me think Marzen. The spiciness of the hops seems to intensify as the glass goes down. The mouthfeel is a little bit sharp but also a tad thin. Very nice lager beer indeed.
Herb-malziger Antrunk mit viel CO2. Wenig hefig. Herb bleibend, das am Anfang wenig intensive Hopfenaroma nimmt etwas zu. Milder Ausklang. Insgesamt unspektakulär. 12/8/9/8//8

Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prága. Kissé rezes, világosbarnás szín, tetején sűrű kemény, piszkosfehér hab. Illata igazán kellemes, nagyon kicsit malátás, kekszes, és van benne egy almás, narancshéjas gyümölcsös illathalmaz, mindezek csak csalogatnak bennünket az újabb kortyok felé, nem túl erősen, ám érezhetően jelen vannak. Ízében is van az édeskés malátás alapíz körül egy vajas, kekszes karamellás édesség, majd az egész átmegy finom gyümölcsös kesernyés komlóba, megvan a kellő összhang az összetevők között. Továbbá közepesen testes, nem annyira szénsavas, száraz nedű, tehát jó nagy kortyokban tudjuk pusztítani, nagyon finom!
Bottle (50 cl) from the brewery, brought to me by a colleague. Beatitiful dark amber with a rich off-white head. Bisquity malt aroma with gentle floral and grassy hops. Soft bitterness.
On tap at brewery/restaurant in Prague. Dark amber color, pretty bitter hoppy taste and palate. Not bad but they do better ones.
Bottle. Cloudy Amber colour with a cream coloured head. on first sip it appears watery but each subsequent sip fills the mouth with flavour. really interesting beer. medium gas.

Draught at the brewpub. Nice deep amber color, reddish, tall fine head. Fruity, light caramel aroma. Rich, fruity, clean, tasty. Low sweetness, with bread, a touch of caramel, grapes or plums, and a nice bitter finish. Almost ale-like. Just slighty chewy.

On tap at Klásterní Pivovar Strahov on 12th July 2010. Amber as described with thin decaying white head. Fascinating taste spectrum. Plenty of grassy herby hop; very delicate spice notes and some rich malt. Earthy pungency rounds off the flavour pleasantly and there is a hint of Christmas berries in the backtaste, although so slight it doesnt cloy the beer at all. Dry finish, light texture. This is a very well-crafted beer indeed and worthy of a high mark.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Tap @ Strahov. Pours a amber reddish color with a creamy head and lacings. Sweet vienna caramel feel. Dry and sweet toffee, buiscuit and caramel. Medium and smooth palate. Ends dry. Very fine Vienna. Rerate 2015: caramel, chewy and bready! Just Lovely! 3,6 - 4,0

on tap - Klasterni Pivovar Strahov. Nice amber color with creamy slow diminishing head. Malty nose with a honey maly flavor with just the right touch of sweetness, nice lightly bitter finish. My favorite beer of those available at the brewpub.

Draught at the brewpub shared with a friend - thanks. Poured a lovely murky ruby red body with a small-medium sized off white head that went away relatively slowly.  Grainy, almost husky and slightly eggy malty nose. An interesting malty woody sweet taste, notes of bubblegum, light hop aftertaste. A lovely Vienna.

Draught. High creamy and lasting white head. Clear golden body. Good strong barley malt aroma with grassy notes. Mild but good barley malt flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2016 Hazy orange with a lasting off-white head, leaving lace. Clean malty biscuit aroma. Sweet and malty flavour with a little hops. Some bitterness in the finish. Extremely drinkable and tasty

Sampled at Dogbricks Eurostash tasting on 4.30.09.  Clear amber color with a big white head.  Malty aroma with some yeast.  Mostly malty flavor, but there are some bitter hops in there as well.  Not bad.

Sample at the Eurostash tasting on 04/30/09: Bottle from the brewpub. The beer is a hazy golden-amber color with a medium thick and foamy bone white head that diminishes slowly. Sticky patches of lacing on the glass. Caramel malt aroma with notes of floral hops. Medium body with sweet caramel malt flavor offset by resiny and floral hops. The finish is malty with a sweetness left over. Above average overall.
Nice colour, very bitter, full, strong, keeping the foam for long. Drunk at Chyse bar, Prague 8 - Cimice.
On tap @ the brewery. Comes slightly hazy dark golden colour, complete with a generous white head. Fruity aroma with some hops presence as well. Sweet caramel flavour turns hoppy to the end.

on tap at the brewery, pours light amber, tall off white head.  Soft hoppy nose.  Sweet carmel, and assertive hoppyness in the finish.  Well rounded and refreshing.  Paired extremely well with the spicy goulash.

Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague. August 08. Amber with large white head. Malt, bread and spicy aroma. Flavour is caramel, bread, spices and a touch of honey. Well balanced, light bitterness in the finish.
On tap @ the brewpub. Clear amber colour, white head. Light fruity aroma with hop notes. Flavour is sharp, bitter, pilsnerlike with a little fruitiness. Too harsh.

bottle, bought at the brewery. Hazy golden-amber yellow, large head. Lovely hoppy aroma. Full-bodied, solid malty base with fantastic hoppy flavours thrughout. These hops are a real pleasure, very aromatic with a pleasant bitterness. Well-balanced beer, fantastic stuff.
Murky amber with mediummoff white head. Malty aroma with caramel and mild hoppy notes. Sweet and hoppy flavour with caramel notes.

(draught, at the Strahov Monastery, Prague) hazy dark orange colour, towering, slightly tanned head. aroma is sublte pale malts, pistachios and perfumed, lemony floral hops. flavour has strong, lightly roasted malts, pistachio, earthy hops. mild carbonation, medium body, light bitter finish.

(6/24/08) Draught at the brewpub in Prague. Cloudy dark orange-amber with a medium stable beige head. Aroma of caramelly malt, yeast and some hoppy notes. Sweetish flavor with malt, some caramel, light toastiness. Finishes with strong hoppy bitterness, a bit grassy. Medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

(Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Prague, 20 July 2008) Dark amber colour, slightly hazy, with frothy, beige head. Fruity, slightly citric nose with notes of dried apricots, yeast and Seville orange. Malty, fruity, slightly citric taste with toffee, chocolate and a bittersweet finish. Very nice beer sampled in very nice surroundings.

Tap @ Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague.
Pours muddy, dark amber with a big, lightly creamy, white head. Aroma is malty, good caramel, weak grass and hay. Medium carbonation, great creaminess. Flavour is marred by the tiniest amount of cardboard, otherwise, it’s great. Caramel backbone with super dry hoppiness, grass and light fruitiness. Ends with a long, lingering caramel note. Good.
From tap at Strahov Monastary Prague ... Hazy red orange ... light hop nose ... mellow fruity ... some blood orange ... little tart ... very pleasent

From tap at brewpub. Pours hazy/unclear deep orange with a slowly collapsing, creamy and off-white. Solid breadish and spiced aroma. Flavour is sweet breadish with a nice hoppy spice touch. Quite nice flavour. Ends dry and bitter with a nice spice note.

Lovely reddish hazy beer with a fine fluffy head.
A bit sweet, fruity, dry finish, lots of aromatic hops packed in.
Easy drinking, yet with a nice nutty flavour. Good beer!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hazy orange opaque colour with big beige bubbly head. Aroma is quite yeasty and malty. Flavour is yeast, malts, some hops and mild notes of wood. Also some diacetyl. Nothing very special.

Draught @ the brewpub. Lovely average beige creamy head that mostly lasted. Somewhat cloudy amber color. Nice display of lacework. This was surprisingly hoppy with mild notes of dusty hops, hint of citrus, and in general I got this floral experience. Over the palate came lovely nutty, caramel, yeast and light grainy feel. Again this was a unique experience and I really enjoyed the scenario and the live music coming from the monastery nearby. Medium bodied with an average carbonation and dry smooth dusty texture. Moderated bitter and sweet flavor in a well balanced way. Dry floral bitter fresh and crispy finish. Ohhh yes I will have one more please.

Labeled "amber" at the brewery. Unfiltered orange/amber appearance to the body, with a small tan head on top.  First flavor is chewy toffee malt, some sweet caramel as well, with the nose being quite similar but having some small notes of diacetyl, along with a strange but mild burnt nut scent.

Nice place but a little crowded. I could drink two samples of  the brewery only at  night because a lot of tourist. This beer worth the trouble, because it is a complex stuff. Nice hazy amber body and a pillowy-fluffy head. Delisicious appearance. Complex, fruity nose of floral hop, some bayern-vienna malt, delisicious yeast. The taste and the body is complex beacause of citurs flavours, balanced hop and good malt tastes. Smooth mouthfeel. Drinkable and rich beer...

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at brewpub (Klásterní Pivovar Strahov, Prague)
The look: Partly cloudy dark-golden body with a large off-white head
To me a typical Czech Polotmavé (Czech Amber Lagers) is: Hay and biscuit wrapped in caramel.  Very light fruity notes with no specific fruits giving the impression of slightly fruity caramel.  Moderately sweet.  Sweetness is well balanced by dry grassy hops.  Body is smooth.  Medium carbonation.
This one: As above but with less caramel and more Saaz hopping than average for the style making it feel halfway between a Svelté (Czech Pilsner) and a Polotmavé.

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de citron et de malt. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée voilée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de citron et de pamplemousse avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Houblon en arrière goût. (Rating #1512)

This is a very good example of a vienna lager.  The hops are maybe a bit strong, but it blends well with the malt.  It was by far one of my favorites in Prague.  That is saying a lot given the vast choices of excellent Czech beers/

Draught, Strahov/Praha.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is medium amber.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly hoppy (flowers, grapefruit).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/creamy texture, lively carbonation.

Not a particularly interesting aroma, and the sourness in the flavor balance doesnt work well for me.

Tap at the brewpub.   Hazy amber with a big and pillowy white head.   Malty and suprisingiy citrusy hoppy aroma that reminds me of sierra nevada, and is quite refreshing in Prague.   The flavor has lots of grapefruit hops and finishes really juicy and bitter.   Raminds me a lot of an APA.   Medium body with higher carbonation and a tounge scouring finish.   Very nice and different for the marzen/vienna style that the brewery claims.   I like the daringness of their beers.
I had this in Prague and brought two bottles of this and their dark back to the States. Flavorful and hearty with a nice hop finish. Nice. Highly recommended.

Draft - Hazy amber body, huge thick beige head; A little to small malty fruity nose, lots of plain malt and lots of ripe pear; Big bubbled carbonation on balanced complex slightly bitter body; Long lasting bitter finish, malty bitter, lots of fresh malty aroma. Great fresh quite malty beer.

Øl fået på bryggeriet i Prag.

Ornage og let ufiltreret.

Duften er meget humlet.

Frugtagtig smag.

Draught at the brewpub (Displayed as: Speciální polotmavé pivo, Amber, 13°,ABV 5,3%), but ok - close enough. Clear amber - offwhite head. Bread, caramel, fresh, grains, hay, fruity, crisp, cactus, tobacco. Nice, but very sudden bitterness. Smooth.

Draught at Klasterni Pivovar Strahov, Praha as Sv. Norbert Jantarový.
Pours a nice amber/orange colour with a medium sized white head and fruity nose. Very aromatic hoppy, floral and citrusy aroma. Hoppy bitterness in the finish.

(Draught at the brewery in Prague) Somewhat hazy golden, offwhite head. Nice hoppy and fruity aroma, some citrus notes and with malt. Hoppy, floral flavor, citrus, sweeter fruits, grassy and with a great hoppy bitterness in the finish. Definately on my top list for czech beers!!!

Draught at the monastery/brewery; Sv. Norbert Jantarový 13°Hazy copper color. Excellent hop aroma, pure Saaz, with some vanilla. There is some malt in the taste, medium structure, and an excellent hoping, aromatic, bearing a caramel touch, the best in Prague. A wonderful, refreshing, nutty, Saaz, complex Pilsner.Even Florence likes this one!
Draught @ the brewery. Malty with smooth herbal hops. Slight breadyness to the malt and caramel flavours. This was very well balanced.

Draught at da pub.  Hazy orange with a rich, creamy, lacey white head.  Intensely malty and sweet, light floral hops, a bi of grain and even more bready malts and pretzel - good, strong aroma for a light beer.  Crisp, bitter, malty, hopps (fine, elegant hopping).  Creamy medium-full body.  Very dry hoppy finish.  Strong herbiness all the way through, tasted sweetness is more of a suggestion than a component.  Graceful.  Really well-balanced.  Touch of spiciness.  Inordinately refreshing.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011 First ratingDraught at the brewpub in May 2006. Very shady amber color with a big white creamy lasting head. Fresh hoppy "home made" scent. Refreshing citrus hoppy flavor. Good bitterness. Thirst clenching and good for you! This beer alons is worth the trip to Prague.
According to the girl in the bar this beer (13°) was at 5.5% ABV.
Im very surprised to see that the beer has such a low average rating...8/4/9/4/19=4.4RerateDraught at the brewpub on June 5, 2011As "Amber 13 degrees, 5.3% ABV"Hazy brown color, off-white head. Sweet, mineral, malty taste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Sweet, malty, a bit fruity taste.7/4/7/3/14=3.5
I think it was the same, but I couldnt ask well, since there was a party going on, but the flavor was a little lighter, and the aroma too, as well as the foam.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2007 I think this was labelled as a 12, but it was also the amber.  It is one of the several pleasant Viennas I found in the Czech Republic; a style I previously detested.  This beer looks like a dark hefeweizen.  It is orange and cloudy.  Think head.  Some sourness in the flavor, and very drinkable.

Big, offwhite creamy head ovver hazy amber body. Looks absolutely delicious. Light, sweetish caramelly aroma. Deep, resiny, pineish taste with a dry spicy aftertaste. Some acidity. Lovely! A great beer.

On tap at the brewery: Hazy, copper coloured, firm, lacing off-white to beige head; fruity and yeasty aroma with distinctive traces of floral hops; stronger bitter, dry flavour, soft mouthfeel instead; lingering, floral hoppy finish with a tinge of yeast. Good stuff for hoppy people...................

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2013 First experience on tap at the brewpub, in 2005:

The Lure:A towering, compact head on which sit flowery, fruity esters, reminiscent of a Belgian yeast strain. Oranges and a hoppiness which is different from the usual Saaz use the Czechs are known for. 

The Festivities:Green, herbal hop leaves float in a light, big-bubbled body. Finish is soft and quite quenching, as able malts show up to compliment the dryness. 3.4/5

Transcendence:From a different plumage, the same notes may be chirped.

Second tap experience, in 2008:
This time around, the Jantar was extremely well hopped making it very Pilsener-like and its rocky mammoth head of foam could not have been more alluring (think De Dolle). A very solid quencher! 3.8/5

Third experience on tap at the brewpub, in 2013:
Lightly toasted, biscuity malts are balanced out by herbal hops and their bitterness for, yes, a very solid quencher. 3.7/5

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2004 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Prague. Slightly hazy amber appearance. Nice peachy/apricoty fruit and also a little bit floral, ever so slightly honeyed. Very bitter and dry, with a nice soft mouthfeel, really lovely stuff.
Amber colour with a fairly small head. Aroma is malty with some herbs. Flavor is also mainly malts with a nice herbal and spicy finish.

(on tap at the brewpub) Herbal, floral and hoppy aroma. Clear, amber coloured with a thin, lasting and off-white head. Taste is hoppy, bitter and floral. Cant be too excited about this one. Good palate though.

Draught at the brewpub. 
Cloudy amber/orange colour, creamy head. Rich flowery hop flavour, somewhat herbal. Saazy, without being buttery. Chewy. Big balanced bitterness.
Draught. Dark copper with lasting, tan head. Smooth and easy to drink. Semi-malty sweet. Not very bitter.

Tried at source, next to the Strahov Monastery, Hradcany, Prague. Having walked up Petrin Hill, then on to this vantage point, I was ready for a beer. I hadn't reckoned on a microbrewery, but here it was. The advertising board outside said light, amber or dark, as per the standard Czech notation, but it did also say 12, 13 or 14%, rather than the usual symbol for degrees... Now thinking of Belgium, and being in a monastery brewery, I wondered what I was letting myself in for when I ordered an Amber, especially given I still had lots of walking to do in the day! When it arrived it looked like a Rogue beer, deep toffee colour, with a massive, fluffy, beige head. Sweet and biscuity aroma. Sweet and balanced through most of the swig, becoming stronger and more herbal on the finish. After much consideration I decided this wasn't 13%, but it was very nice - with a smooth transition from front to back of mouth, and sweet and juicy notes all the way.
Cloudy amber coloured, nice head. One-dimensional flavour: dominant bitterness. Could obviously use some complexity.
Extremely cloudy amber orange color, large head. Aroma is a bit spicy and hoppy. Taste is initially spicy, but the bitter palate overrules everything.

Sampled draught at Helsinki Beer Festvial.
Pale amber with rich creamy head. Rich aroma of saaz hops - grass and aromatic oils. Rather sweet with soft mouthfeel and wonderful depth in the malt character. Intensely bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2007 good place to visit after a stroll around the castle. the amber looks great - rich amber witha creamy head that lingers. sharp, vinous aroma. smooth and buttery. bittersweet pineapple chunks finish. lots of lacing and a splotchy, yeasty head. brandy-like as it warms.
Light amber colour with a malty character and a firm dash of hops.
